body_html:
If you look at the errors, it does not complain about "avx", but it does complain about "sseX", "avx2" and "fma". Your build command "/arch:avx" only enables compiling with avx instruction set.

@guschmue @vit-stepanovs @mrry What would be the way to enable multiple instruction sets in windows? With "arch:avx" I would have expected "everything up to avx, including all sse's" to be enabled, but that does not seem to be the case.

body:
If you look at the errors, it does not complain about "avx", but it does complain about "sseX", "avx2" and "fma". Your build command "/arch:avx" only enables compiling with avx instruction set.

@guschmue @vit-stepanovs @mrry What would be the way to enable multiple instruction sets in windows? With "arch:avx" I would have expected "everything up to avx, including all sse's" to be enabled, but that does not seem to be the case.
